titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the New York Faculty Committee for Non-Intervention in Cenetral America and the Caribbean: Marvin Gettleman Files TAM 523
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Peter Meyer Filardo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2010-11-22T12:07-0500

did.unittitle: New York Faculty Committee for Non-Intervention in Central America and the Caribbean: Marvin Gettleman Files
did.abstract: The New York Faculty Committee for Non-Intervention in Central America and the Caribbean was active in the 1980s, focusing on arranging visits to El Salvador and Guatemala, to investigate human rights abuses, and the role of United States foreign policy therein, most in cooperation with Faculty for Human Rights in El Salvador and Central America (FACHRES). The files contain reports, notes, newspaper clippings, correspondence, petitions, including some in Spanish, and a photocopy of a special issue of the Guatemalan Church in Exile "Guatemala, a New Way of Life: The Development Poles."

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: New York Faculty Committee for Non-Intervention in Central America and the Caribbean.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:

Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: peter.filardo@nyu.edu

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The unprocessed records are organized into one alphabetically arranged series.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The New York Faculty Committee for Non-Intervention in Central America and the Caribbean was active in the 1980s, focusing on arranging visits to El Salvador and Guatemala, to investigate human rights abuses, and the role of United States foreign policy therein. Most of the visits visits appear to have been arranged by, or in cooperation with Faculty for Human Rights in El Salvador and Central America (FACHRES), a U.S. nationwide organization, and the creator of some of the materials in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains reports, notes, newspaper clippings, correspondence, petitions, including some in Spanish, and a photocopy of a special issue of the Guatemalan Church in Exile "Guatemala, a New Way of Life: The Development Poles," most pertaining to visits to El Salvador and Guatemala to investigate human rights abuses and the relation of U.S. foreign policy thereto.
